front.title: Exposing Conex Throughput using non-TCP Feedback

abstract.t: This draft proposes to relay throughput instead of congestion back into the network in-band at the IP layer, such that the total level of throughput is accessible to all IP devices along the path followed by IP datagrams. The main advantage of this approach is that applications that are not using the TCP protocol as transport protocol could also apply the Conex concept to relay the throughput experienced on the end-to-end path back into the network.
